function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Uneven distributions of daily activities can lead to segregated subsets of the population, increasing the growth rate of infectious outbreaks.","Impact":"Higher growth rate of infectious outbreaks, leading to faster spread of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Promote even distributions of daily activities to lower the growth rate of infectious outbreaks.","Technologies":"Urban planning and design strategies to encourage even distribution of activity hubs.","People":"Resident population of the city.","Owner":"Urban planners, city officials, and developers."},{"Description":"Centralization of daily activities can result in higher R0 for urban epidemics, leading to increased spread of contagious diseases.","Impact":"Increased size and R0 of urban epidemics, with negative epidemiological consequences.","Mitigation":"Decentralize economic activities to slow the propagation of influenza-like outbreaks.","Technologies":"Urban planning and design strategies to decentralize economic activities.","People":"Resident population of the city.","Owner":"Urban planners, city officials, and developers."},{"Description":"Lack of effect on children's R0 due to the breakup of activity hubs, potentially leading to targeted spread of contagious diseases among children.","Impact":"Potential targeting of contagious diseases among children due to scattered nature of children's activity hubs.","Mitigation":"Implement strategies to address the uneven distribution of children's activity hubs and promote consistent distribution for disease spread prevention.","Technologies":"Urban planning and design strategies to address the uneven distribution of children's activity hubs.","People":"Children and families in the city.","Owner":"Urban planners, city officials, and child welfare organizations."}]}
